lead_paragraph: The reunions came as Iran remained silent about the prisoner deal, and as a mystery deepened about a freed American who chose to stay in Iran.

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Jess Bidgood contributed reporting from Hingham, Mass., and Barry Meier from New York.
byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and RICK GLADSTONE

headline.print_headline: As Freed Americans Rejoin Relatives, Mystery Surrounds One Who Stayed Put
headline.main: As Freed Americans Rejoin Relatives, Mystery Surrounds One Who Stayed Put

snippet: The reunions came as Iran remained silent about the prisoner deal, and as a mystery deepened about a freed American who chose to stay in Iran.
abstract: Nosratollah Khosravi-Roodsari, one of five Iranian-American prisoners freed by Iran in recent swap with United States, and about whom little is known, elects to stay in country.
